name: リスター・ザ・シューティングスター
summary: Ristar is a platform game developed by Sonic Team and published by Sega for the Sega Genesis, which released worldwide in February 1995. The game stars an anthropomorphic cartoon star who uses his hands and long, stretchable arms to both move and combat enemies. Reception for the game has been generally positive, but the game's initial release was overshadowed due to the imminent ending of the Genesis's lifecycle and the succession of the Sega Saturn and other fifth generation video game consoles.
